message_1: Let $X$ be the complex projective plane $\mathbb{P}^2$ and let $\mathcal{O}_{\mathbb{P}^2}(1)$ be the hyperplane line bundle on $X$. Consider the following sheaf on $X$: $$\mathcal{F}=\bigoplus_{i=1}^{10}\mathcal{O}_{\mathbb{P}^2}(5i).$$ Calculate the dimension of $H^1(X,\mathcal{F})$, where $H^1(X,\mathcal{F})$ is the first cohomology group of sheaf $\mathcal{F}$ on $X$.
message_2:
To compute the dimension of $H^1(X, \mathcal{F})$, we can use the fact that cohomology commutes with direct sums. In other words, we have:

$$H^1(X, \mathcal{F}) = H^1(X, \bigoplus_{i=1}^{10} \mathcal{O}_{\mathbb{P}^2}(5i)) = \bigoplus_{i=1}^{10} H^1(X, \mathcal{O}_{\mathbb{P}^2}(5i)).$$

Now, we need to compute the dimensions of each of the cohomology groups $H^1(X, \mathcal{O}_{\mathbb{P}^2}(5i))$. We can use the following formula for the dimension of the cohomology groups of line bundles on $\mathbb{P}^2$:

$$\dim H^1(X, \mathcal{O}_{\mathbb{P}^2}(k)) = \begin{cases} 0 & \text{if } k \geq 0, \\ (-1)^{k+1} \binom{-k}{2} & \text{if } k < 0. \end{cases}$$

Since $5i > 0$ for all $i = 1, \dots, 10$, we have:

$$\dim H^1(X, \mathcal{O}_{\mathbb{P}^2}(5i)) = 0$$

for all $i = 1, \dots, 10$. Therefore, the dimension of $H^1(X, \mathcal{F})$ is:

$$\dim H^1(X, \mathcal{F}) = \sum_{i=1}^{10} \dim H^1(X, \mathcal{O}_{\mathbb{P}^2}(5i)) = 0.$$
